How we use your personal information when you apply to organise events on council land or property.

Who we are

Gloucester City Council is the data controller for the personal information we collect when you apply to organise events on council land.

Data controller:
Gloucester City Council
Eastgate Management Suite
Eastgate Street
Gloucester
GL1 1PA

What information we collect

Venue availability queries

When you ask about venue availability, we collect:

  • Email address
  • Event description
  • Preferred dates

Event applications

When you apply to organise an event, we collect:

  • Your name
  • Organisation name (if you represent an organisation)
  • Address
  • Email
  • Phone number
  • Event details (what, when, where, how many people)
  • Activities planned
  • Site plan
  • Risk assessment
  • Insurance certificate

Safeguarding information

For events involving children or vulnerable adults, we may ask for confirmation that staff have appropriate DBS checks. We do not ask for full DBS certificate details.

Why we collect this information

To provide advice on venue suitability and availability

We need your contact details and event information to help you choose the right venue and check if it is available.

To assess and approve event applications

We need your event details, risk assessment, and insurance to make sure events can take place safely on council land.

To coordinate with relevant teams

We share your application with council teams (City Events Group) and sometimes with other agencies (Safety Advisory Group) to assess if your event can go ahead safely.

To protect children and vulnerable adults

We need to make sure appropriate safeguarding checks are in place for events involving children or vulnerable adults.

Legal basis for processing

We process your information because it is part of our public task as a council. This means we have a duty to manage public land safely.

Legal basis under UK GDPR: Article 6(1)(e) - public task

For safeguarding information (if we receive it), we also use:

Legal basis under UK GDPR: Article 9(2)(b) - necessary for safeguarding purposes

Who we share your information with

Within Gloucester City Council

We share your application with the City Events Group. This includes teams responsible for:

  • Festivals and Events
  • Asset Management
  • Environmental Health
  • City Centre Management
  • Open Spaces
  • Licensing
  • Health and Safety

Safety Advisory Group (for larger events)

For larger events, we share your application with:

  • Gloucestershire County Council (Highways)
  • Gloucestershire Constabulary (Police)
  • Gloucestershire Fire and Rescue Service

Licensing team

If your event needs a Temporary Event Notice or premises licence, we may share relevant details with our Licensing team.

How long we keep your information

Email enquiries about venues

Email correspondence is kept in line with our standard email retention policy.

Event applications

We keep event applications for a set period. This period is currently being confirmed.

Your rights

You have rights under data protection law:

Right to be informed

This notice tells you how we use your information.

Right of access

You can ask for a copy of the personal information we hold about you.

Right to rectification

You can ask us to correct information that is wrong.

Right to erasure

In some cases, you can ask us to delete your information. We cannot do this during application assessment or during required retention periods for approved events.

Right to restrict processing

In some cases, you can ask us to stop using your information temporarily.

Rights that do not apply

Right to data portability

This only applies when processing is based on consent or contract. Event applications are public task processing, so this right does not apply.

Right to object to processing

This right does not apply to public task processing. We process event applications because it is our duty to manage public land safely.

How to exercise your rights

To exercise any of your rights, contact:

Data Protection Team
Email: data.protection@gloucester.gov.uk

Data Protection Officer
Email: dpo@gloucester.gov.uk

Phone: 01452 396396

Address:
Eastgate Management Suite
Eastgate Street
Gloucester
GL1 1PA

We will respond within 1 month.

Cookies

If we introduce an online booking system, we will only use essential cookies to maintain your session during the application. We will not use analytics or marketing cookies.

Complaints

If you are unhappy with how we handle your information, you can complain to the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO).

Information Commissioner's Office

Website: ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint

Phone: 0303 123 1113

Updates to this notice

We may update this privacy notice from time to time. Check this page for the latest information.
